title: Live Chart Rendering
description:
Design a live line chart that updates roughly every 500ms (e.g. streaming metrics, stock prices, telemetry). Focus purely on the frontend side: how to feed data into the chart, render updates efficiently, and keep the UI smooth over time.

Key considerations:
- Decide between incremental updates (append/shift points) vs full redraw for each tick.
- Understand the trade-offs between using a charting library (ECharts, Chart.js, etc.) and custom canvas/WebGL rendering.
- Design a requestAnimationFrame loop (or equivalent) so rendering stays smooth without over-drawing.
- Consider using OffscreenCanvas and/or Web Workers to offload heavy work away from the main thread.

You should be prepared to talk about: memory management as data grows (windowing / sliding buffer), how to handle bursts of updates (queueing vs dropping frames), how to avoid blocking the main thread, and strategies like downsampling/aggregation for very large datasets so the chart stays responsive even after running for a long time.
